title: How to Make a Ribbon Watchband

steps.headline: Select a suitable piece of ribbon.
steps.description: The ribbon chosen should be at least the width of the watchband that you're replacing. Depending on the strength of the ribbon, it may need to be slightly bigger or folded double to give more strength.

steps.headline: Measure the ribbon against each watchband end to end.
steps.description:
You will also need to account for some additional length that will let you tie the ribbon in a bow. Once measured, cut the length. steps.headline: Thread the ribbon through each of the watchband bars on either side of the watch face.

steps.description: This will prevent the ribbon from fraying at the ends.

steps.headline: Tie around your wrist to keep it in place.
steps.description: It's recommended that you make a small double knot to ensure that the watch stays in place. You may need to make readjustments during the day.

Select a suitable piece of ribbon. The ribbon chosen should be at least the width of the watchband that you're replacing. Depending on the strength of the ribbon, it may need to be slightly bigger or folded double to give more strength. Measure the ribbon against each watchband end to end. You will also need to account for some additional length that will let you tie the ribbon in a bow. Once measured, cut the length.
